page.title: 19RELIGION
page.content: Originally there was 4 different churches in Rhynie Parish and now there is no regular Sunday worship. Presbyterian - On the resignation of the present minister in August 1984 it was decided to join the parish of Rhynie, Clatt, Garily and Kennethmont due to the falling attendances. The new charge is called the Tap a North and a new minister, when appointed, will live in Kennethmont. The many houses in Rhynie being put up for sale. Services are to be held in Rhynie on a fortnightly basis. Rhynie, also for the first time in its life, will no longer have a resident minister. Church of England - Their church, St. Marys, meets approximately once per month during the summer and can be quite busy.
